    4 Kickstarter Exclusive Fatty Bursters with cards;
    1 Ballista;
    12 Kickstarter Exclusive New Equipment and Vault Cards;
    1 Kickstarter Exclusive Horde Tile;
    31 Kickstarter Exclusive Survivors with cards:


Rocco
Thomas
Jeanne
Kelsey
Cassius
Ygraine
Ryan John
Hyg
Hyld
Marquis De Roget
Earl Jaimie
Sigrun The Slayer
The Great Zanzibar
Gannicus
'Badger' Brummuin
Warchief Lividia
Billy
Anton Guffen
Sir Schwarz
Countess Ordella
The Deathmaster
Brannog Steelgreaves
Grayson Gruber
Spearhead
Zee
Lorentz
Fylguria
Princess Ayla
Finarton The Giant
Brix Moonshine
Asmodeus.

Name: Alien Artifacts: Fate Enhancer Promo Card
Description:
1 promo card.

Fate Enhancer: When you take a Trade action, if all cards drawn are of the same Type, shuffle them back into the appropriate deck and draw again. Then pass this card to the left.

The card text SHOULD be:
Fate Enhancer: When you take a Buy action, if all cards drawn are of the same Type, shuffle them back into the appropriate deck and draw again. Then pass this card to the left.

Name: Scissor Fight
Description:
An abstract shape matching and spatial reasoning game for anyone who can be trusted with scissors. 
Players take turns cutting out shapes from scrap paper and fitting them into existing shapes without going over the lines. Points are scored by fitting into existing shapes while covering over your opponents shapes. Points are lost by going over the edges and being covered over. First player to 10 points wins.

Name: Wedge
Description:
Bluff and Bet your way to victory. Wedge uses the deceptively simple mechanics of bluffing and set creation to regulate this clever game of wedging your card into just the right spot.

The game uses just a deck of cards, a handful of player markers and betting chips to create a linear line from 1-20. Players use cards valued from 1 through 20, dealt at random, to create the line. Placing adjacent to blocks can score you big points but that windfall can also be seen by opponents. Do you go for the obvious points or try to bluff and take your opponent's wagers.

A game of Wedge takes only 20 or so minutes and it is a great ice-breaker to get things kicked off or a nice closer to wind things up.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ninja Math Game
Description:
Karate-chop your way through addition and subtraction to become a maths master!

Getting Started:

Each Player chooses a bingo card.  Place the cards on a flat surface, with the sides with blue(for addition) or red(for subtraction) origami stars facing up.
Put the spinner and bingo chips in a central location where all players can reach them.
Each player gets on bingo chip to mark the "free" space in the middle of his or her bingo card.
Players may use scratch paper and a pencil to take notes during the game.

Playing the Game:
The youngest player goes first.
For addition, on your turn, spin the spinner twice and add the two numbers together.  when you know the sum of the two numbers, see if it's on your bingo card.  If so, cover it with a bingo chip.
For subtraction, on your turn, spin the spinner and determine if the the number it lands on is the answer to any of the subtraction problems on your bingo card.  If so, cover it with a bingo chip.
Game play moves to the left and continues until a player has three bingo chips in a row.  If you have three in a row, yell out "Ninja Math!"
For an additional challenge, try playing until someone has filled all of the squares on their bingo card.

Name: Wokou
Description:
Designed for the 2018 Nine Card Contest.

Set in Ming Dynasty China, Wokou is a solitaire game of revenge. After being left for dead, the player must sneak into the Wokou camp in order to take back their father's stolen sword and eliminate the dreaded Pirates.

Using a variable play area of seven cards and minimal components, the player must sneak through the Wokou camp using an intuitive dice pulling mechanism. Once the camp has been alerted, the player will use a dice based combat system in order to take their bloody revenge.

The winning conditions are simple. You either kill all of the Wokou, or die trying. Good Luck!

Name: Blood in Space
Description:
Blood in Space is a micro but complete set of rules for solitaire or co-op skirmish game, set on a sci-fi background. “Micro” refers to the small set of rules, the small time required to complete one game session and the small number of miniatures required (4-10 figures being a common range).

The game includes eleven Scenarios covering iconic sci-fi scenes like exploring the planet surface, attacking an enemy base, searching an abandoned starship, freeing prisoners. Event markers placed on the Map will create the needed Fog of War and randomize the placement of enemies, events and of course loot! Terrain rules allow to quickly create different planetary conditions.

Scenarios can be played individually or as part of a Campaign game: in this case a flowchart will (randomly) determine the next mission; as an example, after a “Exploration” mission a bad roll could send your characters on the “Ambush” scenario. Characters on a Campaign will be able to improve their characteristics, but with the improvement of the Reputation Level of your Crew, your enemies will also become stronger.

Activation of units (friendly and enemies) is managed with a pool of activation markers, but you can never be sure that every unit will be activated. When an “Enemy” marker is drawn by the pool you will roll on the ENEMY ACTIVATION table in the current Scenario to determine the unit to activate and its orders.

Name: Quirkies
Description:
Quirkies is a fast-paced game that mixes art, visual perception and reasoning skills. Players stack matching creature cards in order to create sequences and win Quirkies tokens.

The player to the left of the dealer goes first and places one card from their hand onto the matching creature on the Quirkies Board Card. As long as the creature type matches, the card may have any color and any pattern.

If a player succeeds in creating a winning sequence, they may collect a token of their choice and must then play one more card from their hand. Their turn ends after they played that second card, even if they manage to create another winning sequence.
After placing their card(s), the player replenishes their hand back to 6 cards and the turn moves clockwise to the next player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bottom: The Card Game
Description:
Bottom is a fast moving card game for 2 to 6 players, based on the UK comedy series of the same name starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.

Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, trying to acquire Fiendish Scheme cards. 
Once a player has possession of these cards they will soon discover that keeping hold of them is a different challenge as their opponents steal, and fight, to gain the advantage.

This is a free Print and Play game. All of the necessary files can be found in the files section below.

THIS GAME (AND RULES BOOKLET) CONTAINS EXPLICIT LANGUAGE AND CONTENT UNSUITABLE FOR PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 18.

Bottom is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Secret Adventures of The Old Hellfire Club
Description:
Legendary are the tales told of The Hellfire Club. Since time immemorial we have decided the fates of Empires. How times have changed...

In The Hellfire Club two to eight players take on the roles of the destitute final members of an ancient aristocratic secret society as they recount­ the tales of their greatest adventures to the patrons of the shadiest public houses of Old London Town. Drawing on the cards in their hands for inspiration, the players will weave an ever more elaborate (although far from honest) tale of daring and adventure in the hope that the drinking den’s patrons will offer them a penny for their woes. As competition for the pennies on offer increases, so too do the exaggerations and outright lies the players will tell about their role in the story in the hope of making themselves seem more deserving. But watch out – at any time another player can challenge your version of the story by playing a less impressive card from their own hand thereby revealing your exaggeration and taking the rewards for the story that would otherwise have been yours! When the tale reaches it’s thundering climax, whoever has been given the most pennies wins the game!

--

The Old Hellfire Club is a storytelling card game featuring push-your-luck and memory mechanic that add a spark of tension to an otherwise hilarious game. At its heart is the deck of 100 Boast cards. The Boast Deck includes 100 cards in 10 suits themed around a full spectrum of Victorian melodrama from motives and perils to crimes, insults, and teatime and each illustrated with an excerpt from an original Victorian era masterpiece! Players cooperate to tell a story including the plot elements from their own cards, but opponents can challenge the active player’s boasts by playing less impres­sive cards of the same suit with lower values. Thus, lies are unmasked, embarrassing truths revealed and any pennies earned by the active player that turn are lost!

Name: Catan: Het Duel Big Box
Description:
This reimplentation of the Catan card game includes both expansions so you can build your principality and undergo the hardships and golden times that the settlers from Catan encountered on their path.

The basic game also includes three theme sets with extra cards, which offer many options for variable strategies. So you make a trip through three eras: "The Golden Age", "A time of conflict" and "The great progress". In the end all cards can also be used together in the ultimate version of the game "Duel der princes".

In the box you will find the expansions "Age of Darkness" and " Age of Enlightenment".

Age of Darkness
Three theme sets provide even more variety: "A time of intrigue", in which the religious struggle between supporters of modern and conservative religions is central, connects to "The Golden Age". "A time of merchants" comes chronologically before "The great progress" and "A time of barbarians" afterwards. This last theme set introduces elements from the board game expansion "Cities & Knights".

Age of Enlightenment
With the three theme sets in this expansion, we continue our journey through the history of Catan. "A time of discoverers" takes place between "The great progress" and "A time of barbarians". In this theme set, the residents of Catan explore the archipelago within the reach of their new ships. In "A time of the wise" other aspects from the time of "The Great Progress" are discussed. The history of Catan ends chronologically with "A time of prosperity": the barbarians are defeated and the independence of Catan is assured. Time to look after the interests of the residents of Catan and to lead them to golden times.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Ultima Ratio Regis
Description:
Ultima Ratio Regis is board game, which recreates the military history of the Modern European era; starting with the discovery of America, and ending with the French revolution.

The game spans 20 turns of 15 years, with a duration of two to four hours each; and is organized into multi-turn scenarios, including a possible "Great Campaign" that would cover all 20 turns.
In Ultima Ratio Regis, players will lead the different powers that disputed world hegemony during the sixteenth to eighteenth centuries.

According to the scenario chosen and the number of players, a power pack is distributed to each player.  The initial scenarios supplied are between 3 and 5 turns (each turn is a game session).

During these sessions, in consecutive impulses and in a card driven system, the players take action with their powers to obtain victory points (which are the objectives that each power pursues).

Although there are economic and diplomatic actions, Ultima Ratio Regis is a military campaign game, so it is focused on the different naval or land campaigns that the powers carried out in the modern age to achieve their objectives.

The military system is very original (it covers half of the rules), and with it, we not only fight great land and naval battles, but also sieges and long land campaigns of erosion of the enemy.  The scale of play varies depending on where we have our military units, but to give us an idea, a western land unit represents approximately a whole regiment, and a naval squadron about 10 ships of line or between 30 and 50 galleys in the Mediterranean.

The game include a new system that prevents great uchronies, without over-directing the players.  In this way, the player with the most victory points accumulated between all his powers wins, that is, the one who has come closest to the objectives of the set of powers he is carrying.

-description from designer
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: 1976 The Entebbe Blitz
Description:
"1976 The Entebbe Blitz" is a solitaire war game depicting the action performed by Sayeret Matkal, one of the Israeli Special Forces, in the airport of Entebbe, Uganda, where a group of terrorists who had hijacked an Air France Boeing were keeping the crew and the Jewish passengers as prisoners.

A daring operation, far from the home bases 4000 kilometers and 8 flight hours, which was a success with the liberation of the hostages and the elimination of the terrorists, with the loss of just one officer and few hostages but some wounded soldiers.

It includes:

86 counters, a A3 map, updated rules... you just need 2 d6!!

Name: Disney Cars Racing and Action Game
Description:
Disney Pixar Cars Racing and Action Game
- Fast paced racing game and action game
- Includes four buildable cars to play the racing game
- Travel Size
- Suitable for ages 4+ and 2 or more players

2 in 1 game:
Racing game - it's a tileplacemnet game
Acion game - like UNO

Content:
- 4x 3D cars
- 50 cards
- rules

Name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Treasure Trove
Description:
Treasure Trove includes more souvenir cards to shuffle into the souvenir deck, legendary artifact cards for you to discover, and injury cards which give you a choice to take a random disadvantage rather than give up a treasure when hit by a fireball.

These cards won't be in the retail game which is what is being shipped to backers so they will come as an extra package. The publisher has said that they will be selling it only through their web store, conventions, and maybe the BGG store.

This expansion to Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar is a collection of cards unlocked via stretch goals during the Kickstarter campaign.

Contents:
Hangry (12 souvenirs that ramp up the meanness to 11!)
Injuries (12 cards you can take instead of losing a treasure)
Legendary Artifacts (6 super-powerful souvenirs)
Bonus Souvenirs (18 new souvenirs to add to your regular deck)
3 Blank souvenir and 2 blank injury cards so you can make your own designs

Name: Last Days of Athobrae
Description: Last Days of Athobrae is a competitive, turn-based, resource-gathering strategy game.  Players take on the mantle of one of five unique civilizations trying to collect the resources that will allow them to build a spaceship and escape their dying planet. Each player's turn consists of 3 actions that allow them to navigate the planet, gather resources, build technology, and attack other players.  Once all players have taken their turn, it is time for the doom phase, when world-convulsions shake things up!  In a race against the world's demise and opposing players, first one to build and fuel their ship is the winner.  If the world falls completely to pieces before anyone can escape, the game ends with no winner.  Can you survive...?

Name: Stierkampf
Description: There are 6 cards, illustrated with a bullfight scene und numbered from 1 to 6, that are used as game boards. Each player has his own card. Each time the number of a card is rolled, the player of this card moves his pawn one space ahead. The first player whose pawn reaches the last space, wins the game.

Name: Die lustigen Frösche
Description:
Each player has 3 frogs, he has to get from the starting spaces of their color at the bottom of the game board to the destinations of the same color at the top. Movement is determined with one die.

On the roll of a "1", a frog may advance from it's colored starting space to the firs green space of his race track. From there the frogs advance according to the numbers rolled. If a player rolls a "6" he may roll a second time. If a frog moves over one of the three picture strips the player may roll again, and has to move the same frog a second time.

If a frog lands on the 1st or 3rd picture strip it may only advance again at the roll of a "5". A frog that lands on the 2nd picture strip has to return to the green space at the beginning of its race track.

The first player to get his 3 frogs to his destination spaces wins the game.

Name: Adventurer's Kit: Expedition
Description:
Adventure's Kit: Expedition is a treasure-collecting card game for 2-4 players. The game is designed for younger ones to start with, as it becomes more strategic with aggressive play for adults. In the game, players send out expedition teams to explore ancient continents and collect world-famous artifacts.

To set up the game, draw ten culture cards, then place them on the appropriate continents on the game board sorted according to their age. Place museums and relics to the side as they are bonuses acquired during the game. Each player starts with five expedition cards in hand; if anyone holds an event card, they should discard it, and redraw until they have five cards, after which event cards are shuffled back into the deck.

On a turn, draw one expedition card, then choose to either send out the expedition team (i.e., place the specialist cards on the table), replace any number of specialists in hand by redrawing, or explore. You can explore only if you've already established an expedition team. When you explore, see whether the cards played match any of the artifact requirements on the table; the artifacts can be retrieved by consuming certain specialists, and the player can continue exploring the next card in the same continent as long as the requirements match. At the end of your turn, check that all four continents hold at least one artifact; if not, draw ten new culture cards and place them as at the start of play.

The game ends after 5/7/8 museums or relics have been uncovered, depending on whether you have 2/3/4 players in the game. Players then tally their scores from artifacts collected, along with any bonus points they've acquired. Whoever has the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Plus Pack
Description:
Die rote Metallbox enthält neben dem Basis-Kartenspiel auch die beiden Themen-Sets "Politik & Intrige" sowie "Handel & Wandel".

The red metalbox contains the Catan Card Game and the two expansions "Politics & Intrigue" and "Trade & Change".

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Arkham Asylum Expansion
Description:
In Arkham Asylum, violent and criminally insane villains are locked away from Gotham's citizens in specially constructed cells. But often, these villains break free and it becomes Batman's job to bring them back to the asylum before their darkest whims are realized.

And, as is often the case, the Joker seems to be missing. Chances are he can be found in Jokerland, an abandoned fun fair the Clown Prince of Crime converted into his own playground. Here, attractions are functional, but from a mad man's point of view, and they aren’t really fun in any conventional sense.

This expansion includes two game boards: Arkham Asylum and Jokerland, coming with three scenarios each. Jokerland will include various attractions, shaped as double-sided overlays, which provide a lot of replayability, as the combination of attractions change with each scenario. These attractions offer unique atmospheres and terrain types that change the way you navigate the map. Of course, you can’t imagine an expansion like this without thinking about the villains. This box is absolutely brimming with bad guys and you won’t find a single hero among them. Within you will find a horrific faceless version of the Joker, as well as the Mad Hatter and his inseparable sidekicks, the Tweedle brothers.

-description from the Kickstarter page

Name: Crossing the Atlantic
Description:
A “ Counter and Dice ” Game for up to Five Players
Each player chooses a coloured counter, as in LUDO, and when he throws the dice moves the counter to the number that turns up. An extra turn is given to the player who throws a six. The first player to reach the end of the journey is, of course, the winner.
